the emotional toll of hair loss Mandy41 Phebe38

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2007 04:04AM Amera wrote: Hard to imagine now, but you will feel better. I had 4 AC, 3 weeks apart. I'd feel kinda funky for the first week, especially after the steroids would wear off. The exhaustion would hit like a ton of bricks. By week 2 I usually felt okay, if still a little tired. By week 3 I felt almost normal. The effects were somewhat cumulative but each treatment hit me a little differently. Hang in there! Amera
Posts.Title: are there ANY good days? Methusala gshoemate

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2007 04:18PM - edited Sep 25, 2007 02:54AM by Amera Mary Jo, I second what everyone else is saying but wanted to add one thing. The weightÂ gain is likely from the steroids. I gained and lost the same 7 lbs all through chemo. One day I couldn't button my pants and the next, they were falling off. Don't worry too much about it. Hopefully you will breeze right though. Amera

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2007 03:18PM Amera wrote: Even if the dentist and oncolgist give you the okay, keep in mind that your mouth, like all tissues, will be super sensitive during chemo. It will likely be pretty uncomfortable.
Posts.Title: Chemo and dental TerryNY TerryNY
Necessity of radiaton after lumpectomy/lymphodema katymom Amera

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2007 12:45AM - edited Sep 8, 2007 12:47AM by Amera I actually lost most of my lashes and brows during the 3rd round of AC. They came back fully, probably about 8 weeks after I'd finished. That said, my brows and lashes are more lush and filled in than ever. Â I used Clinique brow pencil for the brows. They have one with a brush at one end that sort of blurs the line from the pencil. This was great when I still had a few brows left. When they completely fell out, I used that, plus this stencil thing I got at Sephora. That worked pretty well. The lashes I mostly left alone as the mascara pulled the few I had left, and they came out with the brush. I just used some medium brown eye liner right on the lash line. When they started to come in but were short, I used the double wanded mascara (cannot remember the brand) where you put a whitish coating on first, then the mascara. That did the trick until they were back to normal. Â Phew, long post. I felt so much more normal when the brows came back, even though my hair took some time growing back. Good luck.
Posts.Title: eyelashes and brows mkl48 Traci-----TripNeg

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2007 05:34PM Amera wrote: Hi gals, I'm popping over from the Jan, 2007 board to lend my support and encouragement. If you read our archives at Christmas time, you will see that we were feeling just the way you are now. I had 4 rounds of AC, 3 weeks apart and then radiation. Oh and also a lumpectomy/SNB and re-excision for clear margines. You can do this. It is much scarier thinking about it than going through it. Someone said it's not as bad as Lifetime tv chemo but not as pretty as soap opera chemo. I think that about sums it up. Stay on top of your meds and remember that your oncologist is your friend. He/she has all kinds of tricks to use to help you get through this. And of course, the gals youÂ  befriend on your Jan 2008 board will become like sisters. Hard to believe now, but once you've shared an experience like this, it really does make for a special bond. Hang in there. Don't worry too much about Christmas. I just went through the motions last year and really just wanted to get the (chemo) show on the road. A year from now, you'll be cheering on the Jan 2009 gals. XXOO Amera
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63
